summary: This is an internal staffing report for the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, dated August 12, 2019. It details severe staffing shortages, particularly among correctional officers, and lists recruitment efforts and incentives. The document is significant as it provides context about the operational conditions at the facility where Jeffrey Epstein was held prior to his death.

events.title: MCC New York Career Fair
events.description: MCC New York held a career fair at 290 Broadway, with 174 potential applicants in attendance.

events.title: Scheduled Officer Start Date
events.description: Two additional correctional officers were scheduled to start work at MCC New York.

events.title: Incentive Approval
events.description: MCC New York was approved for a 10% relocation incentive and a 10% recruitment incentive.

keyFacts: As of August 12, 2019, MCC New York had an overall staffing level of 84.86% and a correctional services staffing level of 83.70%.
There were 19 vacant officer positions and 24 P01A Correctional Officer positions, none of which were filled.
The facility had been running recruitment advertisements on 97.1 FM, in the NY Times, and in The Chief, and held a career fair in July 2019.
In 2018, 43 total positions (including 12 officers) were returned, indicating high turnover or vacancy rates.
